tp:treatment-sec.p: Diagnosis. Yellow longitudinal stripe dorsally, basally on pronotum and medially along entire scutellum. Head longer than wide, mandibular plates longer than clypeus. Antenniferous tubercles with lateral and ventral tubercles. Antennomere II longer than the remaining antennomeres taken together. Genital cup of pygophore striate. Paramere crown falcate, with microtrichia laterally. Segment X up to two times longer than wide. Gonocoxites VIII as long as wide, swollen, facing posteriorly; posterior and mesial margins setose.

Redescription. Coloration. Dark green, with a median yellow stripe anteriorly on pronotum and along scutellum; corium of each hemelytron yellow with several dark green punctations; membrane of each hemelytron hyaline with dark, irregularly shaped markings ( Figs 1-2 , 9 ). Ventrally, body and legs greenish-yellow, with dark green punctations; yellow median stripe from sternites IV to VII ( Fig. 10 ). Antennae brownish, labium dark brown.
